title: Exploring Attack Resilience in Distributed Platoon Controllers with Model Predictive Control. (arXiv:2401.04736v1 [eess.SY])
abstract: The extensive use of distributed vehicle platoon controllers has resulted in several benefits for transportation systems, such as increased traffic flow, fuel efficiency, and decreased pollution. The rising reliance on interconnected systems and communication networks, on the other hand, exposes these controllers to potential cyber-attacks, which may compromise their safety and functionality. This thesis aims to improve the security of distributed vehicle platoon controllers by investigating attack scenarios and assessing their influence on system performance. Various attack techniques, including man-in-the-middle (MITM) and false data injection (FDI), are simulated using Model Predictive Control (MPC) controller to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses of the platoon controller. Countermeasures are offered and tested, that includes attack analysis and reinforced communication protocols using Machine Learning techniques for detection. translated_title: 对使用模型预测控制的分布式车队控制器的攻击韧性的研究
translated_abstract: 分布式车队控制器的广泛应用为交通系统带来了诸多好处，如增加了交通流量、燃油效率提高以及减少了污染。然而，与此同时，对互连系统和通信网络的日益依赖也使得这些控制器面临潜在的网络攻击，这可能危及其安全性和功能性。该论文旨在通过研究攻击场景并评估其对系统性能的影响，提高分布式车队控制器的安全性。使用模型预测控制器模拟了包括中间人攻击和假数据注入在内的各种攻击技术，以识别车队控制器的漏洞和弱点。提供并测试了包括攻击分析和使用机器学习技术进行检测的，加强了通信协议的应对措施。研究结果强调了集成安全性设计和恶意攻击检测的重要性。
tldr: 这项研究通过模拟各种攻击技术，分析了分布式车队控制器的漏洞，提出了加强通信协议和使用机器学习技术进行恶意攻击检测的对策。
en_tdlr: This research investigates the vulnerabilities of distributed vehicle platoon controllers by simulating various attack techniques, and proposes countermeasures such as reinforced communication protocols and the use of machine learning for malicious attack detection.
